data.title: Q Jones - Football

Ivy League Offensive Player of the Week (Nov. 20, 2023)

All-Ivy Honorable Mention (2023)

Jake Crouthamel Award (2023 team award)

Ivy League Offensive Player of the Week (Nov. 20, 2023)

JUNIOR (2023)

Strong season, earning Honorable Mention All-Ivy recognition … finished second on the team in rushing yards, first among running backs … played in all 10 games with 127 carries for 572 yards (sixth in the Ivy League) for a 4.5 average … had four touchdowns, with a long run of 38 yards … also had 26 catches for 108 yards … opened the season with 14 carries for 62 yards and a touchdown at No. 11 New Hampshire … finished with 99 yards on 17 carries and a touchdown in the home opener vs. Lehigh, while also recording five catches for 21 yards … had five receptions for 17 yards the following week at Penn … had 54 yards on 10 carries at Colgate, along with three receptions for 19 yards … strong effort vs. Columbia, with 16 carries for 73 yards to go with a 16-yard reception … tallied 50 yards on 11 carries at No. 23 Harvard … had 16 carries for 42 yards in win over Princeton, along with three receptions for 13 yards … posted 39 yards on nine carries against Cornell … enjoyed career effort with 16 carries for 124 yards and two touchdowns at Brown to help Big Green clinch a share of the Ivy League title … named Ivy League Offensive Player of the Week … received the Jake Crouthamel Award at annual end-of-year banquet, which is presented to the member of the varsity offense who is an underclassman and who by the vote of the coaching staff, has made the most significant contribution to the success of the team.

SOPHOMORE (2022)

Played in every game and ranked second on the team in rushing with 410 yards, 73 attempts and a 5.6-yard average … added 15 receptions (tied for third on the team) for 125 yards (fourth) to his contributions … opened the season with 44 yards on six carries, including a 21-yard gain, in the 35-13 win over Valparaiso … first run the following week at Sacred Heart ended up being the longest Big Green play of the season, a 68-yard touchdown on Dartmouth’s first possession … finished the game with a season-high 158 yards on a mere 12 handoffs while also grabbing three passes for 31 yards … those 189 all-purpose yards were the most by a Big Green player all season … led the team in rushing against both Yale and in the 27-24 win at Columbia, collecting 80 yards on 15 carries in the latter … also had a key 11-yard catch in the game’s final drive to help set up the game-winning 32-yard field goal with four seconds to play … hauled in a season-best four throws for 28 yards against Harvard … took the handoff nine times in the season finale against Brown, picking up 44 yards to play a part in the 30-7 triumph.

FRESHMAN (2021)

Saw action in the final three games, taking at least one handoff in each contest … made varsity debut against No. 16 Princeton, gaining one yard on his lone carry … ran seven times the following week against Cornell for a total of 28 yards with a long of nine … final carry came on the penultimate play of the season, picking up a first down on 3rd-and-5 with a 6-yard gain to allow the Big Green to run out the clock in the 52-31 title-clinching win at Brown.

HIGH SCHOOL

Won Colorado’s Gold Helmet Award “presented annually to the state’s top football player, scholar-athlete and citizen, someone who embodies excellence on and off the field” … pushed Colorado High School Activities Association to allow him to play football in 2020-21 after an injury limited him to one game as a junior … made the most of the year, averaging 231 rushing yards per game as a senior while scoring 19 TD … helped Fountain-Fort Carson reach the state semifinals for the first time since 2003 … ran for more than 1,400 yards a sophomore … in 18 career games, accumulated 3,308 rushing yards, averaging more than 183 per game, and ran for 38 TD.

PERSONAL

Full name is Alexisius Jones Jr. … born on Nov. 30, 2002 … babysat for high school coach’s children.
